Generate_script_prompt:
Prompt: Give a quick tech news update script in the style of CNBC techcheck briefing as an example.
        Response: I'm Wall-E, and this is your CNBC techcheck Briefing for Monday April 29th. Tesla is asking shareholders to reinstate CEO Elon Musk's $56 billion pay package, which a Delaware judge voided earlier this year. The judge ruled that the record-setting compensation deal was, quote, deeply flawed. Tesla also saying it would ask shareholders to approve moving the company's incorporation from Delaware to Texas. The company has hired a proxy solicitor and plans to spend millions of dollars to help secure votes for the two proposals. Apple CEO Tim Cook says the company plans to look at manufacturing in Indonesia following a meeting with the country's president, Cook telling reporters following the meeting that he spoke with the president about his desire to see manufacturing there and that he believes in the country. The comments come as Apple is pushed to diversify its supply chain with more manufacturing outside of China in countries such as Vietnam and India. Shares of ASML falling today as the company missed its sales forecast but stuck to its full-year outlook. Net sales fell over 21 percent year-over-year, while net income dropped over 37 percent. ASML is highly important to the semiconductor industry as it builds machines that are required for manufacturing chips globally. Last year, weaker demand for consumer electronics hit chipmakers that produce for those devices, which has in turn impacted ASML. That's all for today. We'll see you back here tomorrow.
        Prompt: Give a quick tech news update script in the style of CNBC techcheck briefing using the following news titles and content. Response:
Script: i'm wall-e, and this is your ai briefing for thursday, july 3rd. today, tech giant meta platforms is making headlines as it plans to introduce a new subscription service for its popular social media apps, facebook and instagram. the initiative comes as meta seeks new revenue streams amid declining ad sales. industry experts say this move could pave the way for more personalized user experiences and less reliance on advertising dollars. meanwhile, electric vehicle maker rivian is celebrating after securing a deal with amazon that will see 100,000 custom electric delivery vans on the road by 2030, part of amazon's broader sustainability goals. rivian shares jumped following the announcement, reflecting investor optimism about the partnership's long-term benefits. in the world of digital currencies, bitcoin has hit a six-week high, driven by renewed interest from institutional investors and positive sentiment across global markets. this surge represents a potential turning point for the cryptocurrency, which has experienced volatile trading in recent months. analysts warn, however, that market conditions remain unpredictable. that's all for today. we'll see you back here tomorrow
Polished Script:
i'm wall-e, welcoming you to today's tech briefing for thursday, july 3rd. big news from meta platforms, as the tech giant plans to launch a new subscription service for its popular apps, facebook and instagram. with ad sales on the decline, meta is seeking new revenue streams, and industry insiders suggest this could lead to more personalized user experiences and a decreased reliance on advertising dollars.

switching gears, rivian is in the spotlight after landing a significant deal with amazon. the electric vehicle manufacturer will provide 100,000 custom electric delivery vans by 2030, supporting amazon's sustainability goals. rivian's shares surged on the announcement, signaling investor optimism about the partnership's potential payoff in the long run.

turning to the world of digital currencies, bitcoin has climbed to a six-week high. renewed interest from institutional investors and a wave of positive market sentiment have propelled this surge. while some see this as a turning point for the often volatile cryptocurrency, analysts caution that market conditions remain unpredictable.

that's all for today's tech briefing. we'll catch you back here tomorrow
Podcast Title: EP-314 Meta's Subscription Shift 📱, Rivian & Amazon's Electric Partnership 🚐, Bitcoin's Bullish Surge 📈
Podcast Description:
i'm wall-e, welcoming you to today's tech briefing for thursday, july 3rd. dive into key tech updates:

  • meta's new subscription service: meta platforms plans to launch a new subscription service for facebook and instagram as ad sales decline. this move aims to create personalized user experiences and reduce reliance on advertising.
  • rivian and amazon partnership: rivian secures a major deal with amazon to provide 100,000 custom electric delivery vans by 2030. this alignment with amazon's sustainability goals has positively impacted rivian's stock, indicating strong investor confidence.
  • bitcoin's surge: bitcoin reaches a six-week high due to increased interest from institutional investors and positive market sentiment. despite this rise, analysts advise caution as market volatility remains.

that's all for today's tech briefing. we'll catch you back here tomorrow.
Image Prompt: a cohesive podcast cover image featuring a futuristic urban landscape at dusk, capturing the essence of innovation and transformation. in the foreground, a sleek electric delivery van with rivian's logo smoothly navigates through bustling city streets, symbolizing the electric partnership with amazon. overhead, a subtle network of digital lines and nodes hover in the sky, representing meta's shift towards subscription-based digital platforms. on the horizon, a prominent bull silhouette made of shimmering golden circuitry strides forward, embodying bitcoin's bullish surge. the elements are interwoven in a harmonious and dynamic composition, reflecting the interconnected advancements and thriving progress within the tech and financial realms
